revised_title: Observations on Fossil Bones Encrusted with Calcareous Earth
tldr: The author examines fossilized bones encrusted with calcareous earth and discusses their accumulation, structure, and the differences in bones found in various locations. The author suggests that the bones' accumulation may not be due to instinctive modes of living, as the same mode could not suit both carnivorous and herbivorous animals.
